message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.CL

This paper proposes a novel attention mechanism for video-based action recognition, which involves learning a saliency mask for spatial attention and a soft temporal attention mechanism for identifying relevant frames. The paper also introduces regularizers to ensure coherence in space and time. Given the focus on video analysis and machine learning techniques, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves training a model, which suggests the possibility of it belonging to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves analyzing and evaluating the model's performance, which could place it in cs.MM (Multimedia). The use of regularizers and attention mechanisms suggests a focus on artificial intelligence, which could place it in cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper involves natural language processing for describing the proposed approach, which could place it in cs.CL (Computation and Language).
